intro: Calonema cleistogamum, commonly known as the closed flower calonema, is a rare and unique species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and the production of small, inconspicuous cleistogamous flowers that remain closed throughout their development. These flowers do not open, which is an adaptation that facilitates self-pollination in the absence of pollinators. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Calonema cleistogamum is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
